Service Runtime Calls

A service runtime call is analogous to a system call, in terms of performance; for this reason, you should avoid unnecessary service runtime calls. More...

Detailed Description

A service runtime call is analogous to a system call, in terms of performance; for this reason, you should avoid unnecessary service runtime calls.

To use this API, include <sys/nacl_syscalls.h>.

Function Documentation

void _exit ( int  status  ) 

[POSIX] Terminates the program, returning a specified exit status.

Parameters:
status The status to be returned.
Returns:
Exit does not return.

clock_t clock ( void   ) 

[POSIX] Returns approximate processor time used by a program.

(Deprecated.)

Returns:
clock returns a clock_t time value on success. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int close ( int  desc  ) 

[POSIX] Closes the specified file descriptor.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor to be closed.
Returns:
Open returns zero on success. On error, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int gettimeofday ( struct timeval *  tv,
void *  tz 
)

[POSIX] Gets the current time of day.

Parameters:
tv A pointer to struct timeval, where the time is written.
tz Unused.
Returns:
On success, gettimeofday returns zero. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int imc_accept ( int  desc  ) 

[Native Client] Accepts a connection on a bound IMC socket, returning a connected IMC socket descriptor.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor of an IMC bound socket.
Returns:
On success, imc_accept returns a non-negative file descriptor for the connected socket. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int imc_connect ( int  desc  ) 

[Native Client] Connects to an IMC socket address, returning a connected IMC socket descriptor.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor of an IMC socket address.
Returns:
On success, imc_connect returns a non-negative file descriptor for the connected socket. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno. The returned descriptor may be used to transfer data and descriptors but is itself not transferable. appropriately.

int imc_makeboundsock ( int  sock_and_addr[2]  ) 

[Native Client] Creates a bound IMC socket and returns a descriptor for the socket and the socket address.

Parameters:
sock_and_addr An array of two file descriptors. On successful return, the first is set to the descriptor of the bound socket, and can be used for, e.g., imc_accept. On successful return, the second descriptor is set to a socket address object that may be sent to other NativeClient modules or the browser plugin.
Returns:
On success, imcmakeboundsock returns zero. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int imc_mem_obj_create ( size_t  nbytes  ) 

[Native Client] Creates an IMC shared memory region, returning a file descriptor.

Parameters:
nbytes The number of bytes in the requested shared memory region.
Returns:
On success, imc_mem_obj_create returns a non-negative file descriptor for the shared memory region. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int imc_recvmsg ( int  desc,
struct NaClImcMsgHdr *  nmhp,
int  flags 
)

[Native Client] Receives a message over a specified IMC socket descriptor.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor of an IMC socket.
nmhp The message header structure to be populated when receiving the message.
flags TBD
Returns:
On success, imc_recvmsg returns a non-negative number of bytes read. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int imc_sendmsg ( int  desc,
struct NaClImcMsgHdr const *  nmhp,
int  flags 
)

[Native Client] Sends a message over a specified IMC socket descriptor.

descriptor.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor of an IMC socket.
nmhp The message header structure containing information to be sent.
flags TBD
Returns:
On success, imc_sendmsg returns a non-negative number of bytes sent to the socket. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately. The returned descriptor may be used to transfer data and descriptors but is itself not transferable.

int imc_socketpair ( int  pair[2]  ) 

[Native Client] Creates an IMC socket pair, returning a pair of file descriptors.

These descriptors are data-only, i.e., they may be used with imc_sendmsg and imc_recvmsg, but only if the descriptor count (desc_length) is zero.

Parameters:
pair An array of two file descriptors for the two ends of the socket.
Returns:
On success imc_socketpair returns zero. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately. The returned descriptor may only be used to transfer data and is itself transferable.

int ioctl ( int  desc,
int  request,
void *  arg 
)

[POSIX] Manipulates device parameters of special files.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor
request The device-dependent request code.
arg An untyped pointer to memory used to convey request information.
Returns:
Ioctl usually returns zero on success. Some requests return positive values. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

off_t lseek ( int  desc,
off_t  offset,
int  whence 
)

[POSIX] Moves the file offset associated with desc.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor
offset If whence is SEEK_SET, the descriptor offset is set to this value. If whence is SEEK_CUR, the descriptor offset is set to its current location plus this value. If whence is SEEK_END, the descriptor offset is set to the size of the file plus this value.
whence Directive for setting the descriptor offset.
Returns:
On success, lseek returns the resulting descriptor offset in bytes from the beginning of the file. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

void* mmap ( void *  start,
size_t  length,
int  prot,
int  flags,
int  desc,
off_t  offset 
)

[POSIX] Maps a specified descriptor into the application address space.

Parameters:
start The requested start address for the mapping
length The number of bytes to be mapped (must be a multiple of 4K)
prot The protection
flags The modes the descriptor should be mapped under. The only allowed flags are MAP_FIXED, MAP_SHARED, MAP_PRIVATE and MAP_ANONYMOUS.
desc The descriptor to map
offset The offset within the file specified by desc.
Returns:
On success, mmap returns the address the descriptor was mapped into. On failure it returns MAP_FAILED and sets errno appropriately.

int munmap ( void *  start,
size_t  length 
)

[POSIX] Unmaps the region of memory starting at a given start address with a given length.

Parameters:
start The start address of the region to be unmapped
length The length of the region to be unmapped.
Returns:
On success, munmap returns zero. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

void null_syscall ( void   ) 

[Native Client] A stub library routine used to evaluate syscall performance.

int open ( char const *  pathname,
int  flags,
  ... 
)

[not quite POSIX] Opens a file descriptor from a given pathname.

Parameters:
pathname The posix pathname (e.g., /tmp/foo) to be opened.
flags The access modes allowed. One of O_RDONLY, O_WRONLY, or O_RDWR is required. Otherwise, only O_CREAT, O_TRUNC, and O_APPEND are supported.
mode (optional) Specifies the permissions to use if a new file is created. Limited only to user permissions.
Returns:
Returns non-negative file descriptor if successful. If open fails, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int read ( int  desc,
void *  buf,
size_t  count 
)

[POSIX] Reads count bytes from the resource designated by desc into the buffer pointed to by buf.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor to be read from
buf Where the read data is to be written
count The number of bytes to be read
Returns:
On success, read returns the number of bytes read. On failure, returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

int srpc_get_fd ( void   ) 

[Native Client] Returns the value of the -P parameter passed on the command line to sel_ldr.

This is where sel_ldr instances created by either sel_universal or the SRPC interaction of the browser plugin convey the file descriptor of the socket used to perform RPCs.

Returns:
srcp_get_fd returns the file descriptor passed as -P on the command line, or -1 if it was not passed.

int stat ( const char *  path,
struct stat *  buf 
)

[not quite POSIX] Returns information about a file.

Parameters:
path The posix pathname of the file.
buf The struct stat to store the information about the file. Only size (st_size) is valid.
Returns:
On success, stat returns zero. On error, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

void* sysbrk ( void *  new_break  ) 

[Native Client] Sets the system break to the given address and return the address after the update.

If new_break is NULL, simply returns the current break address.

Parameters:
new_break The address to set the break to.
Returns:
On success, sysbrk returns the value of the break address. On failure, it returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.

void thread_exit ( void   ) 

[Native Client] Terminates the current thread.

Returns:
Thread_exit does not return. PENDING: describe

int write ( int  desc,
void const *  buf,
size_t  count 
)

[POSIX] Writes count bytes from the buffer pointed to by buf to the resource designated by desc.

Parameters:
desc The file descriptor to be written to
buf Where the read data is to be read from
count The number of bytes to be written
Returns:
On success, write returns the number of bytes written. On failure, returns -1 and sets errno appropriately.
